name: BactControl
description: BACTcontrol is an automated on-line early-warning system for detection of microbiological activity. A measurement takes approximately 32 minutes.

items.description: An overview of the external ports and connections
steps: 1 - Cleaning solution: A chemical cleaning solution to clean the device in-between measurements.
2 - Sample inlet: The inlet for the sample that the BACTcontrol is going to measure.
3 - Waste outlet: Where the BACTcontrol expells the sample, reagent, buffer and cleaning after it's been used.

4 - USB Port: For transferring data from and to the BACTcontrol. This is used when exporting data, or for updating the device if it doesn't have an internet connection. Note - The Ayyeka wavelet also uses this USB port.
5 - Ethernet port: For connecting the BACTcontrol to the internet.
6 - Power connection: For plugging the power cable into when installing the BACTcontrol. Power switch is located next to it.

items.description: The following tubes and cables need to be connected before running the device. Note: Push the fluid tube into socket as far as possible. To test pull on tube (It should stay fixed)
steps: Push tubes into -
a. Inlet (Sample)
b. Outlet
c. Cleaning (optional)
Insert other tube end into -
a. Inlet - Water sample to be tested
b. Outlet - Collect waste after testing
Connect power cable
Connect Ethernet cable

items.description: This tab displays the measured values.
steps: The first column shows the name of each parameter. The second column shows the value and the third one show the unit.
Note: The measurement interval time of each value may be different.
FluresenceIncreaseAlarm: If the increase in Fluorescence before incubation does not sufficient this alarm indicator turns to read. The default value can be changed in the script.
BubbleAlarm: If the Bubble sensor senses any bubble in the inlet of the device, this alarm arises.
NOTE: The device will be stopped after this alarm arises four times. The default value can be changed in the script.

items.description: In this tab, the final value of each measurement cycle will be saved. The date and time of the measurements and the activity and detection limit for each measurement is logged here and the history of the measurements is shown in tabular data.
steps: Press “Next” or “Previous” to see historic results.
With the “Newest” button the last values will be shown.

items.description: To view the graph of the parameter you can use this tab. By pressing and holding the mouse"s left button you can zoom on the graph.
steps: The period of the time can be selected by the “Start” and “End” fields. The parameter can be changed by the “Value” drop-down list.
Zoom out can be performed by double clicking (mouse left button) on the graph.
NOTE: Please “Abort” or “Stop” the software then press this button.

items.description: For running the program, Double click on the icon of “BC3.0” on the top left side of the desktop.

steps: The shows the current status and access to all the features of the BACTcontrol software.

items.description: The testing procedure takes about 32 minutes. At the end of every cycle, a new test will start again for another measurement automatically.
steps: The results can be accessed by clicking on the highlighted button.

items.description: The final value of each measurement cycle will be shown here. The date and time of the measurements and the activity and detection limit for each measurement is logged here and the history of the measurements is shown in tabular data.
steps: Newer: Cycle forward in test history
Older: Cycle backward in test history
newest: Jump to latest test measurements

items.description: Pressing the Actions buttons displays a popup for aborting or cancelling apart from starting a new test.
steps: Start: will start a normal test but skips other preparation procedures.
Stop: will finish the current test according to the normal procedures.
Abort: will immediately stop with the current test, no data or results are saved.
Close: no tests will be stopped nor aborted. The BACTcontrol will finish the current test and start over.
Exit: will immediately abort, and then close the software
Opening reaction chamber and remove filter
Remove the cover of the reaction chamber. (unscrew nuts)
Remove the ceramic filter with the C-ring and check if they are still suitable (not cracked/broken).
Remove the stirrer with the stirrer removal tool! Be careful! Stirrer is very small
Check for possible biofilm or pollution inside the reaction chamber.
Clean the measurement cell, the glass of the lens and the stirrer with the cleaning solution and dry with a paper cloth
